text: The Tricky Tiger
There once was a kid, a colt, and a calf who were the best of friends.
Their names were Azat, Nurbek, and Nazgul.
One day, the three friends heard about a party at Bear's yurt.

When Bear came by that afternoon to buy honey, Azat said, 
"Bear, can we come to your party?"
"No way," said Bear. "Babies aren't invited."
"I'm not a babyl" said Nurbek.
"Neither am II" said Nazgul.
"Wah. Crying little babies, crying little babiesl" Bear teased.
Azat, Nurbek, and Nazgul were very angry.
They decided to play a trick on Bear.
First, they found a piece of felt drying by the river.
"We'll use this to make a tiger costume," said Azat.
"I'll paint it," said Nurbek.
"I'll make the tiger's head," said Nazgul.
When they were finished, the tiger looked scary.
We're ready, said Azat.
The three friends got inside the tiger costume.
They walked to Bear's yurt.
They heard komuz music and laughter coming from inside.
"Let's give them a hint..." said Nazgul.
"...that the tiger's here!" said Nurbek.
Azat whispered, "Okay. Showtime!"
Inside the yurt, Bear, Wolf, and Fox were having dinner.
But just then, Fox saw a shadow.
She looked up and saw a flash of teeth.
What was that? she cried.
What? asked Wolf.
I thought I saw a tiger! said Fox.
Fox, there's nothing there, said Bear.
Suddenly, Wolf saw a flash of orange in the doorway.
What was that? he cried.
What? asked Fox.
I thought I saw a tiger, too! said Wolf.
You guys are crazy! There's nothing there, said Bear.
But just then, Bear heard a scary sound.
Grrrrrr!
What was that? cried Bear.
Let's go check it out, said Wolf.
The three big animals circled around the yurt ...
and the tricky tiger went inside to wait!

When they got back around to the doorway, 
the tiger jumped out at them.
ROAR!
Aah! cried the big animals, and they ran away as fast as they could.

Then the three friends took off the tiger costume and 
laughed and laughed.
That was so fun! said Nurbek.
We got them good, said Azat.
Now let's eat! said Nazgul.
They feasted on fried bread, honey, nuts, and fresh fruit.
Little did they know, Bear, Wolf, and Fox were creeping back.
Do you see the tiger? whispered Bear.
No, said Wolf, "but I do see some baby animals."
We've been tricked! said Fox.
They ran into the yurt growling.
Aah! Run! cried the baby animals.

When the dust settled, Bear was holding Fox's tail,
Fox was biting Wolf's leg, and Wolf was biting Bear's ear ...
and the baby animals were long gone.
Outside, Azat jumped up onto a tree branch.
He helped pull Nurbek and Nazgul up behind him.
The big animals gathered below.
I'll flatten you like a pancake! yelled Bear.
I'll chew you up like bubblegum! growled Wolf.
I'll gobble you down like chocolate cake! said Fox.
The baby animals had a plan, though.

They whispered, "One ... two ... three!" and then jumped 
as hard as they could.
The branch broke.
BAM! It fell right onto the big animals and knocked them out!
After that, the three friends quickly ran home.
Let's stay away from them, said Nurbek.
Far away! said Nazgul.
Okay, said Azat, "unless you want to make a lion costume!"
